channel.title: Potfowarding help i;ve been trying for hours
channel.description:
I have been trying for hours to get my server to work. I have already portforwarded as of on my other computer i already portfowarded in the same router and it was working, now nothing is woring, i tried going from diffrent angles, making sure my virtual servers had the right tcp/udp and making sure that the port was right. i tried utorrent but agian no work. I have a belkin router, and i have teamviewer if needed, please help me for i am tired of trying but like hosting servers.
sincerly, A coder in need

@deathschaos9 wrote:

I do believe he fixed it already.

baddy351:

No but somehow it made it work

Read full topic

item.title: Potfowarding help i;ve been trying for hours
item.dc:creator: @s_p_i_d_a_z s p i d a z
item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:1, topic:351159”]I have been trying for hours to get my server to work. I have already portforwarded as of on my other computer i already portfowarded in the same router and it was working, now nothing is woring, i tried going from diffrent angles, making sure my virtual servers had the right tcp/udp and making sure that the port was right. i tried utorrent but agian no work. I have a belkin router, and i have teamviewer if needed, please help me for i am tired of trying but like hosting servers.

sincerly,
A coder in need[/quote]

Do you have your server starting up on the same port that you portforwarded to? Try logging in to 127.0.0.1

Read full topic

item.title: Potfowarding help i;ve been trying for hours
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:7, topic:351159”]I read the tutorial step by step

belkin F5D8236-4v1

Death, you have teamviewer to show me what im doing wrong?[/quote]
Go ahead and PM me your teamviewer login info

acecanine:

make sure you have “path” and “classpath” right

Neither of those have anything to do with opening a port.

Read full topic
